    • Method Detail

      • getRow

        public int getRow(int r)
           throws NoSuchRowException
        This method passes the row number to the array and returns the value at that index.
        Parameters:
        r - is the row index 0-2 in the array Rows.
        Returns:
        the value of the array at that index.
        Throws:
        NoSuchRowException - if the row index is out of the range, an exception is thrown.

      • getNumberOfRows

        public int getNumberOfRows()
        This method returns the number of rows. My only use for this method has been for looping.
        Returns:
        the number of rows.

      • play

        public void play(int r,
                 int s)
          throws NoSuchRowException,
                 IllegalStickException,
                 NotEnoughSticksException
        This method removes the sticks from the rows as selected by the player
        Parameters:
        r - row of array
        s - sticks in row to be removed
        Throws:
        NoSuchRowException - if the player selects a row other than 0-2.
        IllegalStickException - if the player ties to remove 0 or more than 3 sticks in one move.
        NotEnoughSticksException - if the player tries to remove more sticks from a row than exists in that row.

      • isOver

        public boolean isOver()
        this method checks to see if there are sticks to remove after a play has been performed. if there are, returns false. if there are not, returns true.
        Returns:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        this method is for debugging.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        returns in a string the number of sticks present in each of the 3 rows.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments
